page.title: 07LACE IN BEDFORD
page.content: In 1977 a group called the {Aragon {Lacemakers }was set up in response to a nationwide interest in lacemaking. It started with 30 members and now has 120 adult members and 60 juniors. They meet every six weeks and have speakers and outings to places of interest for lacemakers. They also have two open { {Lace Days}a year when they demonstrate lacemaking. This interest has been taken up by local schools and there are six schools in Bedford which teach lacemaking. The children are supplied with polystyrene lace pillows and plastic bobbins and are taught basic lace patterns. Our local museum and art gallery has many fine examples of lace.
